title: An Enhanced Large Language Model For Cross Modal Query Understanding System Using DL-KeyBERT Based CAZSSCL-MPGPT
author: Shreya Singh (DIT University, Dehradun, India), ...
relevance_why: The methods of cross-modal query understanding and enhancement of large language models could be relevant for improving multimodal integration in audio-related tasks.
background: This paper presents an advanced system for understanding queries that involve both images and text, improving how machines process and respond to such inquiries.
contribution: This paper introduces an enhanced framework for cross-modal query understanding using a combination of DL-KeyBERT and CAZSSCL-MPGPT, achieving high accuracy in datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods do not effectively mitigate the bias introduced by echo chamber effects in image processing and struggle with accurate semantic relationships.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates a knowledge graph and advanced optimization techniques to improve performance and reduce bias.

key_innovation: Utilizes a Conditional Random Knowledge Graph to reduce bias from training data while enhancing semantic understanding across modalities.
real_world_impact: This approach could enhance AI applications in various domains requiring accurate interpretation of cross-modal data, such as image captioning and visual question answering.
limitations: No specific limitations are addressed by the author.

new_terms.Conditional Random Knowledge Graph (CRKG: **Conditional Random Knowledge Graph** is a graph-based approach that represents entities and their relationships conditionally to enhance knowledge extraction without biases.
new_terms.CAZSSCL: **Cross Attention Layer and Zero-Shot Semantic Consistency Learning** refers to a method designed to improve alignment between different data modalities without prior labeled data.
